input.clinical_notes: 65-year-old male with type 2 diabetes mellitus for 15 years. Recent labs show creatinine 1.8, BUN 45, microalbuminuria present. HbA1c 8.2%. Patient on metformin and glipizide. Complains of fatigue and ankle swelling.
input.patient_history: HTN, obesity, family history of diabetes

input.clinical_notes: 72-year-old female presents with progressively worsening dyspnea on exertion, orthopnea, and bilateral lower extremity edema. Echo shows EF 35%. BNP elevated at 800. Currently on furosemide.

58-year-old male reports persistent depressed mood, anhedonia, fatigue, and sleep disturbances for 10 weeks. PHQ-9 score of 15. Significant functional impairment at work and home. No suicidal ideation.
input.patient_history: Previous episode of depression 5 years ago, responded well to sertraline

input.clinical_notes: 45-year-old female with history of kidney transplant 3 years ago due to polycystic kidney disease. Currently stable on tacrolimus and mycophenolate. Creatinine stable at 1.2. No signs of rejection.
input.patient_history: ESRD secondary to polycystic kidney disease, kidney transplant 2021

input.clinical_notes: 68-year-old male with history of COPD presents with acute worsening of dyspnea, increased sputum production, and wheezing. Chest X-ray shows hyperinflation. Currently using albuterol and ipratropium inhalers.
input.patient_history: 50 pack-year smoking history, quit 2 years ago

common_coding_mistakes.correction: Always code Z94.x for transplant patients

common_coding_mistakes.mistake: Coding depression as mild when moderate
common_coding_mistakes.correction: Use PHQ-9 scores to determine severity

common_coding_mistakes.mistake: Not coding chronic kidney disease stages
